title: Optimal quest guide

properties.name: description
properties.value: The optimal quest guide lists Old School RuneScape quests in an order that allows new Members to progress in a way that minimises the amount of skill training. This guide does not take into consideration unlockable content, such as fairy rings or dragon equipment, that provides numerous benefits to the player's game progression. For that, it is recommended that players complete the quests in the notable quest unlocks section as soon as possible.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Quests/Strategy
For the free-to-play variant of this guide, see Optimal quest guide/Free-to-play. For the Ironman variant of this guide, see Optimal quest guide/Ironman.

The optimal quest guide lists Old School RuneScape quests in an order that allows new Members to progress in a way that minimises the amount of skill training. This guide does not take into consideration unlockable content, such as fairy rings or dragon equipment, that provides numerous benefits to the player's game progression. For that, it is recommended that players complete the quests in the notable quest unlocks section as soon as possible.

Guide[edit | edit source]

Experience lamps or books of knowledge received through random events or achievement diaries may be used on any skill of the player's choosing or to save time by shortening the next bit of training in this guide.

Players with 50 Construction should take advantage of their player-owned house for access to a portal chamber, teak altar, and mounted glory. Teleport to house (tablet) may also be used for emergency teleport. New players on a budget should use a ring of dueling to access the bank and restore stats.

Completing achievement diaries will be beneficial throughout the game; some of the rewards include access to unlimited teleports, noted item drops, antique lamps, shortcuts, and additional Lunar spells.

Notable quest unlocks[edit source]

The quests below list some of the more notable unlockable content, teleportation methods, equipment, and locations. The quests below are not listed in any specific order.

  • Skill unlocks:
    • Druidic Ritual – Unlocks Herblore
    • Rune Mysteries – Unlocks the ability to use Lamps and Books of knowledge on Runecraft
    • Tears of Guthix – Unlocks weekly access to a minigame that rewards experience in the player's lowest skill, which is useful in aiding progress towards skilling goals.
    • Desert Treasure – Unlocks the ability to use Ancient Magicks
    • Lunar Diplomacy – Unlocks the ability to use Lunar spells
  • Transportation unlocks:
    • Plague City – Unlocks Ardougne teleport (Tablet teleport and spellbook teleport)
    • Enlightened Journey – Unlocks the Balloon Transport System
    • Fairytales Part 1 and start Part 2 – Access to fairy rings
    • Tree Gnome Village – Unlock spirit tree teleports
    • The Grand Tree – Unlocks gnome glider transportation
    • Ghosts Ahoy – Unlocks Ectophial and free passage to Port Phasmatys
    • Watchtower – Unlocks Watchtower Teleport(Tablet teleport and spellbook teleport)
    • Another Slice of H.A.M. – Unlocks the Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system
    • A Taste of Hope - Unlocks Drakan's medallion
    • Eadgar's Ruse - Unlocks Trollheim Teleport
    • Shilo Village - Unlocks Shilo Village cart system
    • Eagle's Peak – Unlocks the Eagle transport system
  • Equipment unlocks:
    • The Great Brain Robbery – Unlocks the Barrelchest Anchor
    • Dwarf Cannon – Unlocks the Dwarf Multicannon
    • Dragon Slayer I – Ability to use green d'hide body, rune platebody and dragon platebody
    • Dragon Slayer II – Ability to create Ava's assembler
    • Family Crest – Unlocks Steel gauntlets
    • Animal Magnetism – Unlocks Ava's device
    • Recruitment Drive – Unlocks initiate armour
    • The Slug Menace – Unlocks proselyte armour
    • Recipe for Disaster – Completion of the subquests unlocks better Culinaromancer's gloves
    • Lost City – Ability to use the dragon dagger and the dragon longsword
    • Monkey Madness I – Ability to use dragon scimitar
    • Monkey Madness II - Ability to use the Heavy Ballista
    • The Fremennik Isles – Unlocks helm of neitiznot
    • The Fremennik Exiles – Unlocks Neitiznot Faceguard
    • Rum Deal – Unlocks Holy wrench
    • Haunted Mine – Unlocks Salve Amulet
  • Area unlocks
    • Priest In Peril – Unlocks Morytania
    • Bone Voyage – Unlocks Fossil Island
    • Throne of Miscellania – Unlocks Managing Miscellania
    • Regicide – Unlocks Tirannwn
    • Mourning's End Part I – Unlocks Lletya
    • Song of the Elves – Unlocks Prifddinas
    • Making Friends with My Arm – Unlocks Weiss
    • Sins of the Father – Unlocks Darkmeyer
    • Below Ice Mountain – Unlocks Ruins of Camdozaal

Quests[edit | edit source]

This list does not include suggestions for combat levels. Some boss fights might be hard to do with the stats listed here. Always make sure to train up your combat stats to a level at which you're confident you can kill or survive dangerous parts of the listed quests.

Hover over a skill reward in the "New levels after quest" column to see the exact total experience in the listed skill after completing the quest.

Bring the Level 3 certificate, Level 2 certificate and Level 1 certificate to Curator Haig Halen to obtain a fruit blast required for Recipe for Disaster: Another Cook's quest and bank it.
Go talk to Historian Minas just up the stairs and tell him the information about the displays, to get the kudos and two antique lamps from the quests you've done. Use them on Woodcutting.

{{External|rs=Quests/Strategy}} {{Otheruses2|def=no|the free-to-play variant of this guide|Optimal quest guide/Free-to-play|the [[Ironman Mode|Ironman]] variant of this guide|Optimal quest guide/Ironman}} The '''optimal quest guide''' lists ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' [[quests]] in an order that allows new [[Members]] to progress in a way that minimises the amount of [[skill]] training. This guide does not take into consideration [[unlockable content]], such as [[fairy rings]] or [[dragon equipment]], that provides numerous benefits to the player's game progression. For that, it is recommended that players complete the quests in the [[Optimal quest guide#Notable_quest_unlocks|notable quest unlocks]] section as soon as possible. ==Guide== [[Experience lamp]]s or [[book of knowledge|books of knowledge]] received through [[random events]] or [[Achievement Diary|achievement diaries]] may be used on any skill of the player's choosing or to save time by shortening the next bit of training in this guide. Players with {{SCP|Construction|50|link=yes}} should take advantage of their [[player-owned house]] for access to a [[portal chamber]], [[teak altar]], and [[Amulet of Glory (mounted)|mounted glory]]. [[Teleport to House|Teleport to house]] ([[Teleport to house (tablet)|tablet]]) may also be used for emergency teleport. New players on a budget should use a [[ring of dueling]] to access the bank and restore stats. Completing [[Achievement Diary|achievement diaries]] will be beneficial throughout the game; some of the [[Achievement Diary Rewards|rewards]] include access to [[Ardougne cloak 1|unlimited teleports]], noted item drops, [[Antique lamp|antique lamps]], [[shortcuts]], and additional [[Fremennik Hard Diary|Lunar spells]]. {{Optimal quest guide/Recommended Quests}} ===Quests=== This list does not include suggestions for combat levels. Some [[Quest boss|boss]] fights might be hard to do with the stats listed here. Always make sure to train up your combat stats to a level at which you're confident you can kill or survive dangerous parts of the listed quests. Hover over a skill reward in the "New levels after quest" column to see the exact total experience in the listed skill after completing the quest. {{#vardefine:colspan|7}}{{#vardefine:questpoints|0}}{{#vardefine:attackxp|0}}{{#vardefine:agilityxp|0}}{{#vardefine:constructionxp|0}}{{#vardefine:cookingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:craftingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:defencexp|0}}{{#vardefine:farmingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:firemakingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:fishingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:fletchingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:herblorexp|0}}{{#vardefine:hitpointsxp|0}}{{#vardefine:hunterxp|0}}{{#vardefine:magicxp|0}}{{#vardefine:miningxp|0}}{{#vardefine:prayerxp|0}}{{#vardefine:rangedxp|0}}{{#vardefine:runecraftxp|0}}{{#vardefine:slayerxp|0}}{{#vardefine:smithingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:strengthxp|0}}{{#vardefine:thievingxp|0}}{{#vardefine:woodcuttingxp|0}} {| class="wikitable lighttable sticky-header align-center-2" data-tableid="OQG" |+Old School RuneScape Quest Guide ! More is better, but collect at least three spare for this purpose. It is also recommended to start [[Rune Mysteries]], [[The Restless Ghost]] and [[Prince Ali Rescue]] while in the area, to speed up completion of these quests later. For a more in-depth guide on which quests to combine to complete all [[Free-to-play]] quests as efficiently as possible, see the [[Optimal quest guide/Free-to-play|free-to-play version of this guide]].
